Heo ongan cweðan to þam þe ðar abutan stodon,
soðlice þes ys of þam.
WSCp MARK 14.70 & he eft ætsoc;
& eft þa ymbe lytel þa ða ætstodon cwædon to Petre,
soþlice þu eart of ðam,
Galileisc þu eart.
WSCp MARK 14.71 Þa ongan he ætsacan & swerian,
soðes ne can ic þæne man þe ge secgað.
WSCp MARK 14.72 & þa eft sona creow se hana;
ða gemunde Petrus þæs hælendes worde þe he him sæde,
ær se hana crawe tua þriwa ðu me ætsæcst;
þa ongan he wepan.
WSCp MARK 15.1 Þa sona on mergen worhton þa heahsacerdas hyra gemot mid ealdrum & bocerum & eallum werodum; & læddon þæne hælend gebundenne & sealdon hine Pilato.
WSCp MARK 15.2 Ða axode Pilatus hine,
eart þu Iudea cynincg;
þa andswarode he him,
þu hit segst.
WSCp MARK 15.3 Ða wregdon hine þa heahsacerdas on manegum þingum.
WSCp MARK 15.4 Eft Pilatus hine axode,
ne andswarast þu nan þing;
loca hu mycelum hi þe wregeað.
WSCp MARK 15.5 Ða ne andswarode se hælend him na mare swa þæt Pilatus wundrode.
WSCp MARK 15.6 On symmeldæge wæs his gewuna þæt he him forgeafe ænne gebundenne swa hwylcne swa hi bædon.
WSCp MARK 15.7 Þa bædon hi Barraban, se wæs gebunden mid þam ræplingum se þurh swiccræft manslyht geworhte.
WSCp MARK 15.8 & þa he ferde þa ongan seo menegeo hine biddan swa heo symle dyde.
WSCp MARK 15.9 Ða cwæð Pilatus,
wylle ge þæt ic eow forgyfe Iudea cyning?
WSCp MARK 15.10 He wiste þæt ðurh andan hine sealdon þa heahsacerdas.
WSCp MARK 15.11 Þa astyredon þa bisceopas þa menegu þæt he him Barraban forgefe.
WSCp MARK 15.12 Eft Pilatus him andswarode,
hwæt do ic be Iudea cininge?
WSCp MARK 15.13 Hi eft hrymdon & cwædon,
hoh hine.
WSCp MARK 15.14 Ða sæde Pilatus,
hwæt yfeles dyde he;
Hi þæs þe ma clypedon,
ahoh hine.
WSCp MARK 15.15 Pilatus wolde þa ðam folce gecweman & forgef him Barraban & sealde him þone hælend beswungenne þæt he ahangen wære.
WSCp MARK 15.16 Þa læddon þa cempan hine on þæs domernes cafertun

& hi tosomne eall werod clypedon. WSCp MARK 15.17 & scryddon hine mid purpuran & him on setton þyrnenne helm awundenne. WSCp MARK 15.18 & ongunnon hine þus gretan, hal wes þu Iudea cyning. WSCp MARK 15.19 & beoton hine on þæt heafod mid hreode & spætton him on & heora cneow bigdon & hine geeaðmeddon.

WSCp MARK 15.20 And syððan hi hine bysmrydon, unscryddon hine þam purpuran & scryddon hine mid his reafum & læddon hine þæt hi hine ahengon. WSCp MARK 15.21 & genyddon sumne wegferendne Simonem Cireneum cumende of þam tune, Alexandres fæder & Rufi, þæt he his rode bære.
WSCp MARK 15.22 & hi læddon hine on ða stowe Golgoða, þæt is on ure geþeode gereht, heafodpannena stow. WSCp MARK 15.23 & sealdon him gebiterod win,
& he hit ne onfeng.
WSCp MARK 15.24 And þa hi hine ahengon hi dældon his reaf & hlotu wurpon hwæt gehwa name.
WSCp MARK 15.25 Þa wæs underntid
& hi ahengon hine.
WSCp MARK 15.26 & ofergewrit his gyltes wæs awriten,
Iudea cyning.
WSCp MARK 15.27 & hi ahengon mid him twegen sceaðan, anne on his swyðran healfe & oþerne on his wynstran.
WSCp MARK 15.28 Þa wæs þæt gewrit gefylled þæt cwyð,
& he wæs mid unrihtwisum geteald.
WSCp MARK 15.29 And þa ðe forðstopon hine gremedon & hyra heafod cwehton & ðus cwædon,
wala se towyrpð þæt tempel & on þrim dagon eft getimbrað. WSCp MARK 15.30 Gehæl ðe sylfne of þære rode stigende.
WSCp MARK 15.31 Eallswa þa heahsacerdas bysmriende betwux þam bocerum cwædon,
oðre he hale gedyde,
hine sylfne he ne mæg halne gedon.
WSCp MARK 15.32 Crist Israhela cyning, astige nu of rode þæt we geseon & gelyfon;
And þa ðe him mid hangodon wæron him mid gebundene.
WSCp MARK 15.33 And þære syxtan tide wurdo þystru gewordene geond ealle eorðan oð nontide.
WSCp MARK 15.34 & to nontide se hælend clypode mycelre stemne,
heloi heloi lema sabbattani,
þæt is on ure geðeode,
min God min God, hwi forlete þu me?
WSCp MARK 15.35 & sume þe ðar abuton stodon & þis gehyrdon hi cwædon,
nu þes clypað Heliam.
WSCp MARK 15.36 Þa arn hyra an & fylde ane spingan mid ecede & on hreod sette & him drincan sealde & cwæð,
